short_answers.question: Short answer question 1 based on Marie Curie.
short_answers.answer: Marie Curie was a great scientist known for her dedication to science. She faced poverty, illness and hardships with courage. Her discoveries changed the field of medicine and physics. She worked for humanity rather than personal wealth.

long_answers.question: Long answer question 1 based on Marie Curie.
long_answers.answer: Marie Curie was one of the greatest scientists in history. She was born in Poland and later studied science in Paris. Despite extreme poverty, she continued her education with determination. Along with her husband Pierre Curie, she discovered radium and polonium. Her research proved useful in medical treatments like cancer therapy. She refused to patent her discovery for personal gain. Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize twice for Physics and Chemistry. Her life shows courage, dedication and service to humanity.

long_answers.question: Long answer question 2 based on Marie Curie.
long_answers.answer: Marie Curie was one of the greatest scientists in history. She was born in Poland and later studied science in Paris. Despite extreme poverty, she continued her education with determination. Along with her husband Pierre Curie, she discovered radium and polonium. Her research proved useful in medical treatments like cancer therapy. She refused to patent her discovery for personal gain. Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize twice for Physics and Chemistry. Her life shows courage, dedication and service to humanity.

long_answers.question: Long answer question 3 based on Marie Curie.
long_answers.answer: Marie Curie was one of the greatest scientists in history. She was born in Poland and later studied science in Paris. Despite extreme poverty, she continued her education with determination. Along with her husband Pierre Curie, she discovered radium and polonium. Her research proved useful in medical treatments like cancer therapy. She refused to patent her discovery for personal gain. Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize twice for Physics and Chemistry. Her life shows courage, dedication and service to humanity.
